description: A collection of circles in a circular formation above a large mostly parallelogram-shaped formation (the bottom of the formation is an obtuse angle, really making it pentagonal). Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a grayish-beige triangle in the center of the circular formation and a thin, darker beige triangle in the center of the mostly parallelogram-shaped formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
